wiktionary_senses.definition: A lustrous, white, metallic element, atomic number 47, atomic weight 107.87, symbol Ag.
Coins made from silver or any similar white metal.
Cutlery and other eating utensils, whether silver or made from some other white metal.
Any items made from silver or any other white metal.
A shiny gray color.
a silver medal
Anything resembling silver; something shiny and white.
Made from silver.
Made from another white metal.
Having a color like silver: a shiny gray.
Denoting the twenty-fifth anniversary, especially of a wedding.
Premium, but inferior to gold.
Pertaining or relating to elderly persons.
Having the clear, musical tone of silver; soft and clear in sound.
To acquire a silvery colour.
To cover with silver, or with a silvery metal.
To polish like silver; to impart a brightness to, like that of silver.
To make hoary, or white, like silver.
An English surname originating as an occupation for a silversmith or a rich man, or for someone having silvery gray hair or living by a silvery brook.
A surname from German.
A unisex given name from English from the metal, or transferred from the surname.
